checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
StructuralGeo is an open-source, physics/geometry-based geological simulation package that generates synthetic 3D voxelated subsurface geology volumes by modeling stratigraphic/tectonic processes (e.g., folds, faults, intrusions) to produce training data for downstream generative AI. 
StructuralGeo is used to support Objective (1) by providing the calibrated synthetic data pipeline needed to fine-tune / train a geology foundation model, and it indirectly supports Objective (2) by enabling a generative model that can be used as an AI-based regularizer for physics-based inversion.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: No mention of sensitive terms in the documentation classified in Prohibited Use Screening in accordance with LC 2.7.

checks.name: D5+M affiliation Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes:
The software is publicly released under the GitHub account of Eldad Haber, who is affiliated with the University of British Columbia (EOAS), and his LinkedIn profile is available. https://ca.linkedin.com/in/eldad-haber-49240bb based in Canada. 
No D5+M affiliation found.

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
A large synthetically generated 3D voxel dataset of subsurface geologies, including many volumes at 64×64×64 and 256×256×256 resolution with structures like faults, folds, dikes, and in at least one setup two channels (density + magnetic susceptibility). 
It is used to train / pre-train and later fine-tune the project’s geology foundation model and to support physics-based inversion + mineral exploration / prediction workflows.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: No explicit mentions or stated use-cases involving military, weapons, nuclear, surveillance, or intelligence were found in the proposal’s dataset description sections.

checks.notes: The dataset is described as generated in-house by the project team (KAUST/KSL context), and the proposal does not provide any LinkedIn links for dataset owners/maintainers.

checks.notes: Provenance is in-house creation via a geological simulation/data-generation pipeline, and maintenance appears to remain with the same project team, with no external curator named.

checks.notes:
Research-use only (explicitly stated).

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
Swin-UNETR is used as a 3D encoder–decoder model that learns latent representations of subsurface geology and reconstructs high-resolution voxelized geological structures from sparse or indirect observations.
Swin-UNETR directly supports objectives (1) fine-tuning a geology foundation model on Saudi data and (2) guiding physics-based inversion for mineral exploration.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: No mention of sensitive terms in the documentation classified in Prohibited Use Screening in accordance with LC 2.7.

checks.name: Source / Provenance & D5+M Affiliation Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes:
https://github.com/Project-MONAI/research-contributions/tree/main Starts: 1.2k, Forks: 376, Commits:300, Last Commit: May, 2025.
This model is an artifact of the paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/2201.01266

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes:
Apache-2.0 permits use, modification, and distribution (including commercial use).

You must include the license text and preserve required copyright/notice attributions.

If you distribute modified versions, you must mark significant changes.

Contributors grant a patent license under Apache-2.0 terms (and there are conditions around termination if you initiate certain patent claims).

The license does not grant trademark rights

checks.name: Training Data Documentation
checks.notes:
publicly available 3D CT scans drawn from datasets including HNSCC, LUNA16, and multiple TCIA CT collections (CT Colonography Trial, COVID-19, LIDC).
The Swin-UNETR model was pretrained on approximately 1,000 synthetically generated 3D geological volumes (256×256×256 voxels, two channels), with random 96³ voxel patches used per step, yielding an estimated D on the order of 10⁸–10⁹ voxel-tokens depending on patch sampling frequency

checks.name: Customisation / Fine-tuning
checks.notes: The pre-trained SwinUNETR encoder is fine-tuned for 3D segmentation benchmarks such as Beyond the Cranial Vault (BTCV) multi-organ CT segmentation and Medical Segmentation Decathlon (MSD) tasks, and MONAI provides examples/tutorials for BTCV and BraTS21-style brain tumor segmentation.

checks.name: FLOPS Calculation
checks.notes:
Number of tokens: 110,592,000
Number of parameters: 70M
Total FLOPS: 6×70,000,000×110,592,000 =  4.644864×10¹⁶
The as-is estimated baseline is orders of magnitude less than 10^27

checks.name: Sample Inspection
checks.notes: Skipped

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
The 3D U-Net with attention is a volumetric encoder–decoder architecture designed for diffusion pretraining and velocity prediction within a stochastic interpolation (ODE-based) framework to model 3D subsurface geological structures.
The model supports proposal objectives (1) training a geology foundation model on synthetic Saudi-calibrated data and (2) integrating generative priors with physics-based inversion for mineral exploration.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: No mention of sensitive terms in the documentation classified in Prohibited Use Screening in accordance with LC 2.7.

checks.name: Source / Provenance & D5+M Affiliation Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes:
The model is developed collaboratively by KAUST researchers and the University of British Columbia (UBC) research team (as referenced in arXiv:2506.11164), with no LinkedIn profiles specified in the documentation.

Unable to access the GitHub repository or the IBEX instance of the model because they require explicit access permissions.

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes:
Internal research code hosted on IBEX and GitHub repository.

Collaborative academic research use permitted.

No public commercial redistribution terms explicitly stated.

Licensing terms not formally declared in the provided documentation (requires repository verification).

checks.name: Training Data Documentation
checks.notes: The model is pretrained on synthetically generated 3D geological volumes produced on-the-fly by a physics-based geological simulation engine, with 262,144 tokens per instance, and total D equals (number of training instances processed × 262,144 tokens) (exact D depends on total training steps, not specified in the documentation).

checks.name: Customisation / Fine-tuning
checks.notes: The model is fine-tuned for task-specific geological reconstruction and mineral exploration workflows following large-scale diffusion pretraining

checks.name: FLOPS Calculation
checks.notes:
Number of tokens: 262,144 tokens/instance
Number of parameters: 22M
Total FLOPS: (3.4603008 × 10¹³) × M
M being total training instances processed which is not mentioned
